intro: Vismia sieberiana, commonly known as the yellow vismia, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and dense, lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and typically white or yellow, arranged in clusters at the base of the leaves. The fruit is a small, round capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
